title: Continuance of Certain Federal Advisory Committees

enrichment.summary: This executive order extends the authorization for a list of federal advisory committees, allowing them to continue operating until September 30, 2027. It also transfers certain presidential functions under the Federal Advisory Committee Act to the heads of the respective departments or agencies responsible for these committees.
potential_concerns: Extending advisory committees for national monuments may lead to prolonged debates impacting Native Americans' interests in ancestral lands without timely resolution.
Small business owners could face indirect burdens if advisory committee recommendations prioritize regulatory frameworks that increase compliance costs.

Religious organizations involved in the Religious Liberty Commission might experience policy shifts that could generate controversies regarding the balance between religious freedoms and civil rights.
Veterans engaging with small business development advisory committees may encounter delays or disruptions if committee functions shift authority among agencies, affecting program continuity.
HBCU students and communities may see limited influence from the continued advisory council if the transferred oversight reduces direct presidential engagement and responsiveness.
